channel.title: VPS Problem Linux (centOS)
channel.description:
Hello,
So I've gotten my source onto the VPS, Installed JDk, editted my run.bat, and now im up to the command to start the server through screen. I know that there are other programs out there to keep the server running but im not familiar with them. Anyways, the tutorial that i am following says that in order to start the server you have to type in the command "screen -A -m -d -S rsps java -classpath bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar server.Server" but every time i do this, nothing happens, it just goes to the next line, like this: [root@vm3585 rsps]# screen -A -m -d -S rsps java -classpath bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar server.Server [root@vm3585 rsps]# [root@vm3585 rsps]# If you are familiar with what to do, please link me to another guide or walk me through it.
Thank You

item.title: VPS Problem Linux (centOS)
item.dc:creator: @Shorty626 Shorty626
item.description:
@Shorty626 wrote:

Does server.Server follow the same server class your server uses? You will not be able to copy and paste someone else’s run script if it does not match your server.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Problem Linux (centOS)
item.dc:creator: @Sora464777 Sora464777
item.description:
@Sora464777 wrote:

Hello,

So I’ve gotten my source onto the VPS, Installed JDk, editted my run.bat, and now im up to the command to start the server through screen. I know that there are other programs out there to keep the server running but im not familiar with them. Anyways, the tutorial that i am following says that in order to start the server you have to type in the command “screen -A -m -d -S rsps java -classpath bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar server.Server” but every time i do this, nothing happens, it just goes to the next line, like this:
[root@vm3585 rsps]# screen -A -m -d -S rsps java -classpath bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar server.Server
[root@vm3585 rsps]#
[root@vm3585 rsps]#
If you are familiar with what to do, please link me to another guide or walk me through it.

Thank You

Read full topic
